newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Saudis abiding by OPEC quota - oil minister.
newsitem.headline: Saudis abiding by OPEC quota - oil minister.

text.p: Saudi oil minister Ali al-Naimi said on Tuesday his country was abiding by the OPEC quota of 8.0 million barrels per day (bpd).

"Our performance stands above all. All these innuendos you see in the press about Saudi Arabia exceeding its quota is a bunch of nonsense," he told reporters on the sidelines of an oil industry conference.
OPEC quotas are assessed as oil sold into export or domestic markets, but not that which is transferred into storage. The OPEC production ceiling has been set at 25.03 million bpd.
Industry analysts have said Saudi Arabia's wellhead production has exceeded 8.0 million bpd for a few months.
"I don't think anybody can stand up and say we have not honoured our commitments," Naimi said.
He said it was too early to say whether OPEC might raise quota levels at its scheduled meeting in November.
"Why answer it now? Why not wait and see all the numbers in November? It's easier, then everything is clearer rather than now. It's rather murky right now.
